text:
Richard Eugene Garmaker (October 29, 1932 – June 13, 2020) was an American basketball player. He played professionally in the National Basketball Association (NBA) from 1955 to 1961. He played for the Minneapolis Lakers and for the New York Knicks.
Garmaker was born in Hibbing, Minnesota. He played college basketball at the University of Minnesota. Garmaker on June 13, 2020 at the age of 87.
